Key Match Events: Spencer Torkelson and Riley Greene each hit a two-run homer, contributing to the Detroit Tigers' 4-1 victory over the Boston Red Sox.
Brant Hurter pitched five innings of one-run ball for the win and got Wilyer Abreu to bounce into a double play.
Jason Foley got his 20th save with a perfect ninth inning.
Jarren Duran's two-out RBI single lifted Boston to a 1-0 lead in the fifth inning.
Spencer Torkelson hit a drive to left for his eighth homer, giving the Tigers a 2-1 lead.
Riley Greene hit a two-run homer in the sixth inning, his 20th of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: Brant Hurter expressed excitement about getting a first-pitch double play.
Riley Greene expressed pride in reaching 20 homers for the first time and contributing to the team's win.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora reflected on the team's struggles with late-game offense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers earned their second series win in the last 13 against Boston and won the season series for the first time since 2017.
The game had an attendance of 30,173 and lasted 2 hours and 22 minutes.
